labels.analysis: The MCP Server is focused on providing access to cryptocurrency research data and tools, enabling users to gather up-to-date blockchain and crypto insights. The available tools are centered around searching for cryptocurrency projects, reports, and news on a specialized knowledge base, which suggests a strong emphasis on research and information retrieval within the cryptocurrency domain.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" fits because the server's core functionality is tied to accessing and managing cryptocurrency research data. The secondary label "Web Search & Research" is appropriate because the tools are primarily used for searching and retrieving information. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: research_get_projects
tools.description: Search for projects on Research knowledge base.

tools.description: Get project details by Twitter username on Research knowledge base.

tools.name: research_get_project_reports_by_twitter
tools.description: Get project reports by Twitter username on Research knowledge base.

tools.description: Search for reports on Research knowledge base.

tools.description: Search for news on Research knowledge base.

Facilitate access to crypto-related resources and operations to enhance LLM applications with up-to-date blockchain and crypto insights. Empower users to leverage crypto data seamlessly within their AI workflows.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@maxvint/mcp-crypto-research/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
